ukb_api package

Submodules

ukb_api.module_bulk_data_handler module

class ukb_api.module_bulk_data_handler.bulk_data_handler

Bases: object

A class to represent family of methods that can to read and fetch bulk data.

display_all_categories()

Utility function which lets user see all the major categories present in the UKB dataset. Reads categories from a static resource file.

Parameters

None – No parameter required for this function.

Returns

List of strings which represent all the data categories present in the UKB dataset.

fetch_bulk_data(subject_list, data_type_string='T1_Image')

A helper function which returns path to imaging and freesurfer data for provided subjects.

Parameters

  • subject_list – A list of subjects of interest.

  • data_type_string – A string representing the type of file to be fetched.

Returns

Paths to files requested for input subjects.

get_data_bulk(field_id=None, subject_id=None)

A helper function which lets user download bulk data related to a subject, invokes datalad under the hood.Download starts after user provides credentials in a new terminal shell.

Parameters

  • field_id – A integer representing a field id.

  • subject_id – A list of subject id’s.

Returns

A string representing the location on bridges2 where file was downloaded.

get_field_ids_for_category(category_name=None)

A utility function which lets user see the associated field ids for each category, reads from a static file containing all the category names and field ids.

Parameters

category_name – A string representing a category name.

Returns

A pandas object having related field ids of the input category.

get_subject_list_field_ids(field_id=None)

A helper function which lets user see subjects having data related to a field_id. Reads a metadata file into a pandas object, only reading relevant columns because of size of the csv file.

Parameters

field_id – A int representing a field id.

Returns

A list of subject ids associated with the input field id.

search_category_by_name(query=None)

A helper function which return closest matching UKB category based on query given by user, uses built-in function to get close match.

Parameters

query – A string representing the query user wants to search for.

Returns

A list of categories closely matching with the input query.

ukb_api.module_genetic_data_handler module

class ukb_api.module_genetic_data_handler.genetic_data_handler

Bases: object

A class to represent family of methods that can fetch list of xarray objects based on combination of list of subjects and variants provided.

get_genetic_data(subject_list=None, variant_dict=None)

The Primary function of the module which allows user to provide a subject list and dictionary which has keys as chromosome numbers and values as a list of variants of interest. If no subjects list is provided 100 random subjects are considered.If no dictionary is provided as input, an exception is raised.

Parameters

  • subject_list – List of subjects which are of interest.

  • variant_dict – A python dictionary having keys as relevant chromosome number and values as list of variants that are of interest to us.

Returns

A single concatenated XArrayDataset.

get_genetic_data_from_snps(subject_list=None, snp_list=None)
The Primary function of the module which allows user to provide a

subject list and list of snps to retrieve genetic data in form of XArray Datasets.

Parameters

  • subject_list – List of subjects which are of interest.

  • snp_list – A python list containing SNPs of interest.

Returns

A single concatenated XArrayDataset.

static get_path_genetic_files()

A static function which lets user see all the genetic data locations.

Parameters

None – No parameter required for this function.

Returns

A string representing the path where Genetic Data is stored on Bridges2.

get_subject_ids()

A utility function which lets user fetch numpy array containing the list of all subject ids.

Parameters

None – No parameter required for this function.

Returns

A list containing the subject IDs.

ukb_api.module_harmonize_fs_data module

class ukb_api.module_harmonize_fs_data.harmonize_fs_data

Bases: object

static get_center(center)
get_demographics_data(subject_list=None)

The primary function of this module which lets user provide a subject list. Returned is a pandas dataframe which has metadata and freesurfer features. If no subject list is provided all subjects are considered.

Parameters

subject_list – A python list of subjects whose freesurfer and metadata features is required.

Returns

A pandas dataframe which has all the features from freesurfer like cortical measurements and subcortical volume numbers.

static get_subject_ids()

A utility function which lets user fetch a list of subject ids whose free-surfer data is available on PSC.

Parameters

None – Needs no parameters to operate.

Returns

A list object containing the subject ids.

ukb_api.module_scalar_data_handler module

class ukb_api.module_scalar_data_handler.scalar_data_handler

Bases: object

A class to represent family of methods for handling and fetching scalar data.

display_all_categories()

The first prominent function which lets user see all the major categories present in the UKB dataset. Reads categories from a static resource file inside package.

Parameters

None – Needs no parameters to operate.

Returns

A list having all the unique categories of UKB.

get_data_scalar(field_id_list=None, subject_list=None)

A helper function which lets user fetch scalar data associated with a field id and subject list.The fields in UKB dataset have been encoded in the following way –> field_id-instance_number-array_index.

field_id: Numerical Number representing a particular feature of UKB

dataset. For example 20252 represents T1 NIFTI files.

instance_number: Currently 4 instances are present in the UKB dataset

represents in which years of study wasdata collected or recorded.

  • Instance 0–> 2006-2010.

  • Instance 1–> 2012-2013.

  • Instance 2–> (2014+).

  • Instance 3–> (2019+).

array_index: It is the identifier present in cases where a single field

id can have multiple values. An example could be multiple readings of blood-pressure taken after fixed intervals.

Parameters

  • field_id_list – list of field id

  • subject_list – list of subject ids of interest

Returns

A pandas object containing the scalar data.

get_field_ids_for_category(category_name=None)

A utility function which lets user see the associated field ids for each category, reads from a static file containing all the category names and field ids.

Parameters

category_name – a string representing a category name.

Returns

A pandas object having related field ids of the category provided as input.

get_subject_list_field_ids(field_id=None)

A helper function which lets user see subjects having data related to a field_id. Reads a metadata file into a pandas object, only reading relevant columns because of size of the csv file.

Parameters

field_id – A integer representing a field id.

Returns

A list of subject ids relevant to the input field_id.
